intro: Sonchus hastatus, commonly known as the hairy leaf sowthistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with hairy stems and lobed, often hairy leaves. Its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in fields, and can be invasive in some regions.
